document_data.name: Brightaxe Hall
document_data.mainbody: '''Brightaxe Hall''' was the seat of power of the ancient [[dwarf|dwarven]] realm of [[Alatorin]], as well as the empire of [[Shanatar]].
document_data.Description:
Essentially an open-ended cavern overlooking the [[Rift of Dhalnadar]], the ''[[Wyrmskull Throne]]'' once stood here.

Nine statues, known as the None Scions of the Forge, were carved into the rift wall beneath the Hall. These depicted fully armored [[shield dwarf|shield dwarves]], and were believed to represent [[Taark Shanat]] and his eight sons.
document_data.Geography: Brightaxe Hall lay at the southern end of the Dhalnadar Span—the only bridge across the Rift of Dhalnadar, which stretched across the [[Underdark]] from below the [[Marching Mountains]] to the [[Calim Desert]].
document_data.History:
Around {{Yearlink|-12000}}, Taark Shanat's eight sons each went on to found their own, separate kingdoms.

Alatorin was eventually conquered by the [[drow]] of [[Guallidurth]] in the [[First Spider War]], which lasted from {{Yearlink|-8170}} to {{Yearlink|-8150}}. The Eight Kingdoms of the dwarves were consumed by the internecine conflict known as the [[Spawn Wars]], and so did not come to Alatorin's aid. Once that conflict had been settled, the Eight Kingdoms banded together and reconquered Alatorin and Brightaxe Hall with it—this campaign was known as the [[Second Spider War]], and lasted from {{Yearlink|-8145}} to {{Yearlink|-8137}}. The eight kings formed the great realm of [[Deep Shanatar]], with Brightaxe Hall once again serving as the seat of power.

But it was not to last. Come the [[Third Spider War]], from {{Yearlink|-6150}} to {{Yearlink|-6120}}, the drow of Guallidurth struck an alliance with the cloakers of Rringlor Noroth. The dwarves of Shanatar were driven away from Alatorin and Brightaxe Hall permanently, taking the ''Wyrmskull Throne'' with them. and the great dwarf-realm never recovered.

As of the {{YearlinkName|1370}}, Brightaxe Hall had become a dragon's lair once more, having been claimed by the [[deep dragon|deep wyrm]] [[Dheubpurcwenpyl]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
When Brightaxe Hall was reconquered following the Second Spider War, the eight victorious dwarven kings all claimed the right to sit on the ''Wyrmskull Throne'' and rule Shanatar. According to legend, the matter was settled when the visor on one of the statues, believed to represent the ancient king of [[Ultoksamrin]], fell off. The dwarf-kings took this as a sign from [[Moradin]], and the king of Ultoksamrin ascended to the throne.

Around 1370 DR, it was rumored that the [[duergar]] [[Army of Steel]] was planning a crusade to reconquer Brightaxe Hall, the ''Wyrmskull Throne'', and much of the eastern territories of ancient Shanatar.
document_data.Inhabitants: * [[Dheubpurcwenpyl]], a deep dragon who made her lair in the Hall ''circa'' 1370 DR.
